channel.title: life on Uncombed Whiskers
channel.description: Recent content in life on Uncombed Whiskers

item.title: Pivot
item.description: As seasons change and years pass, this old brain needs to learn new tricks to satiate it’s unending craving for solving ambiguous and hard problems. Well, it’s time to feed it the next set of problem fodder, so to speak; with an interesting ‘domain centric’ pivot. Here’s raising a ‚òï to jumping into the unknown…sort of üòâ

item.title: Scratchin & Squeakin
item.description: A friend introduced me to scratch today. I wrote a trivial program with it - A plane falling down on an unassuming unaware kitty, with sound effects of course.

item.title: The circus is in town
item.description: Read an article on Haaretz last year. Sadly can’t find the link online anymore. Thankfully, I had the gist copied elsewhere.

item.title: Yearnings
item.description:
Strawberries and Cream.

Oh yeah, that was what I felt like having today; that very english summer delicacy. But alas, neither do we have strawberries lying around nor cream. Driven by my desire to sample this delectable delicacy (and not finding it close at hand), I ended up searching (yes, yes ‚Äì google search ‚Äì the bane of this generation and others to come) for it; and voila, stumbled upon some prose ‚Äì the kind of which we don‚Äôt come across anymore.

item.title: Us
item.description: In Thud, the dwarf Bashfullsson says ‚ÄúI need no axe to be a dwarf, Nor do I need to hate trolls. What kind of creature defines itself by hatred?‚Äù.

item.title: Broken Windows Theory
item.description: Scientific American‚Äôs latest 60 seconds science podcast concerns the broken windows theory which states that ‚Äúin a neighborhood where buildings have broken windows, people are more likely to engage in bad behavior.‚Äù
